poem:
**Streaming Seasons**  

In the living room, Netflix sprawled,  
both a king's feast and a carnival ride—  
a gleaming lobster wit for Oscar's night,  
with garish tinsel tales on the side.  
December serves them both on a platter,  
as couches cradle us, full and fatter.  
Here, the remote is both scepter and wand—  
a kingdom boundless in our hand.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Merry Gentlemen review – more forgettable festive filler from Netflix The unending expansion of Netflix, still easily the most streamed of all the streamers, has turned it into an ambitious one-stop shop for all, home to both the elegant and the gaudy. This gap is never clearer than at the end of the year when the platform’s prestigious Oscar-aiming fare is available alongside its cheapo Christmas movies, the same restaurant offering you both fillet". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Merry Gentlemen review – more forgettable festive filler from Netflix The unending expansion of Netflix, still easily the most streamed of all the streamers, has turned it into an ambitious one-stop shop for all, home to both the elegant and the gaudy. This gap is never clearer than at the end of the year when the platform’s prestigious Oscar-aiming fare is available alongside its cheapo Christmas movies, the same restaurant offering you both fillet
